title: MtlMiners
author: MtlMiners
content: Hello, times are getting tough and I think it’s time for me to sell my 1btc physical coin. Pictures with time stamp will be posted if there’s interest in it.I bought it for 1.3btc about 9 years ago and I’m hoping to get something around that amount if possible. Coin will be shipped from Canada, escrow accepted.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Interested Do you have pictures available?or a link to them and someone can repost them.

comments.author: MtlMiners
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on November 02, 2022, 06:00:00 PMInterested Do you have pictures available?or a link to them and someone can repost them.https://postimg.cc/gallery/75MQgZG

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: MtlMiners on November 02, 2022, 06:22:07 PMQuote from: minerjones on November 02, 2022, 06:00:00 PMInterested Do you have pictures available?or a link to them and someone can repost them.Thanks! https://www.blockchair.com/bitcoin/address/1CC3MpCqN58KKdU3FKryUUy2rduo1VsoUk

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Does anyone have any idea what those black spots on the brass are on the back right side? Normal aging of the coin?

comments.author: MtlMiners
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on November 02, 2022, 06:49:33 PMDoes anyone have any idea what those black spots on the brass are on the back right side? Normal aging of the coin?It’s brass so it’s prone to rust, that’s why I put it in the little coin holder thing. I was told not to clean my coins because it would make it worse over time but I’m also no expert. I think it would come off easy by gently scraping it off dry but I also don’t mind the little spots and don’t want to make it worse since I have absolutely no idea what I’m doing.

comments.author: MtlMiners
comments.body: @quakerbull can we continue DMs on here? This is a new account and I can only send 1 DM per hour. For high res pictures I’d assume I’ll have to send through another platform. Reason for sale : times are getting a lil tough for me. Instead of redeeming the 1btc to sell im trying to see if anyone on here is interested before I rip the back sticker off this beautiful coin.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: MtlMiners on November 02, 2022, 07:31:42 PM@quakerbull can we continue DMs on here? This is a new account and I can only send 1 DM per hour. For high res pictures I’d assume I’ll have to send through another platform. Reason for sale : times are getting a lil tough for me. Instead of redeeming the 1btc to sell im trying to see if anyone on here is interested before I rip the back sticker off this beautiful coin. Here are better close ups... hopefully helps

comments.author: MtlMiners
comments.body: Quote from: 123Dave on November 02, 2022, 09:19:08 PMPm sent New account so I can’t send more than 2 DMs a day. To answer your question : not yetTo all those wondering why it’s a new account, I forgot the credentials to my old one and haven’t been on here since 2017. I do have some + trust on my old one after I sold a casascius to OGnasty in July of 2015.

comments.author: 123Dave
comments.body: I would do 1.15 BTC for this with escrow but i would need someone who is familiar with fakes.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: 123Dave on November 03, 2022, 12:08:35 AMI would do 1.15 BTC for this with escrow but i would need someone who is familiar with fakes. Happy to authenticate any Casascius coins for you or anyone else.

comments.author: 123Dave
comments.body: Sweet, lets see if we can make a deal.

comments.author: 123Dave
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on November 03, 2022, 12:19:36 AMQuote from: 123Dave on November 03, 2022, 12:08:35 AMI would do 1.15 BTC for this with escrow but i would need someone who is familiar with fakes. Happy to authenticate any Casascius coins for you or anyone else. Sweet, let see if we can make a deal

comments.author: MtlMiners
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on November 03, 2022, 12:19:36 AMQuote from: 123Dave on November 03, 2022, 12:08:35 AMI would do 1.15 BTC for this with escrow but i would need someone who is familiar with fakes. Happy to authenticate any Casascius coins for you or anyone else. How would that work? Would a HD zoom call do the trick? I really don’t mind the authentication, it has corrosion spots so you already know it’s about 10 years old. I’m slightly worried about the tiny & almost non existant lost package during shipping which would get doubled if it’s shipped twice.. If I declare the full value of the coin for shipping insurance reasons, would the buyer pay the duties on it? Have you ever authenticated these coins before? What’s the best way to do this?

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: MtlMiners on November 03, 2022, 01:34:57 AMQuote from: minerjones on November 03, 2022, 12:19:36 AMQuote from: 123Dave on November 03, 2022, 12:08:35 AMI would do 1.15 BTC for this with escrow but i would need someone who is familiar with fakes. Happy to authenticate any Casascius coins for you or anyone else. How would that work? Would a HD zoom call do the trick? I really don’t mind the authentication, it has corrosion spots so you already know it’s about 10 years old. I’m slightly worried about the tiny & almost non existant lost package during shipping which would get doubled if it’s shipped twice.. If I declare the full value of the coin for shipping insurance reasons, would the buyer pay the duties on it? Have you ever authenticated these coins before? What’s the best way to do this? From the photos you have provided, the coin appears genuine and the address still states loaded with the 1 btc.If I declare the full value of the coin for shipping insurance reasons, would the buyer pay the duties on it? Have you ever authenticated these coins before? What’s the best way to do this?Depends on where the buyer lives..  in the US, we do not pay customs/VAT fees.Due to the value, best practice at this time would be an agreed in person meeting if possible while funds were held in escrowOther options would be a secure shipping method such as USPS Registered Mail, which can insure value up to $50kI have authenticated hundreds of Casascius coins to date and have recently posted information about fake holograms.Hopefully others can reply with some recommended ideas for this transaction!

comments.author: MtlMiners
comments.body: Quote from: 123Dave on November 03, 2022, 12:08:35 AMI would do 1.15 BTC for this with escrow but i would need someone who is familiar with fakes. Willing to do 1.2 if there’s no better offer. I pay shipping you pay escrow.
